Light is important.
Chemo-physical stuff! Atoms and particles (but not quarks or dark matter)!
Accelerating charges create light; light accelerates charges
$\lambda = \frac{v}{f}$
$c = 3 \times 10^8 \frac{m}{s}$
Since all light waves have the same speed $v = c$, for any light wave $w$ we have $\lambda_w = \frac{c}{f_w}$
$E = hf, h = 6.63 \times 10^{-34} \frac{kgm^2}{s}$ is Planck's constant used in the Einstein-Plank equation for wave energy
Gamma > X-rays > Ultra*violet* > Visible (VIBGYOR) > Infra*red* > (microwaves) Radio
